reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Muy buen parlante
reviews.author: Rogelio V.
reviews.content: El altavoz Soundcore 3 de Anker Soundcore es una obra maestra de la tecnología de audio portátil que combina un diseño robusto, una calidad de sonido excepcional y una duración de batería prolongada. Con su robusta construcción y su capacidad para ofrecer un rendimiento de audio impresionante, este altavoz se posiciona como una opción destacada en el mercado de altavoces Bluetooth.Diseño y Construcción:El Soundcore 3 presenta un diseño elegante y resistente que lo hace ideal para su uso en interiores y exteriores. Sus dimensiones compactas y su peso ligero lo convierten en un dispositivo fácil de transportar, lo que permite llevar la música a cualquier lugar. Con una carcasa resistente al agua y al polvo con clasificación IPX7, este altavoz puede soportar salpicaduras, lluvia e incluso sumergirse brevemente en agua, lo que lo hace ideal para su uso en la playa, piscina o en condiciones climáticas adversas.El diseño de los controles es intuitivo y de fácil acceso, con botones táctiles en la parte superior que permiten controlar la reproducción, el volumen y la emparejación Bluetooth de manera sencilla. Además, cuenta con un puerto USB-C para cargar, lo que agrega comodidad y versatilidad a la experiencia del usuario.Calidad de Sonido:El Soundcore 3 ofrece una calidad de sonido impresionante para su tamaño compacto. Equipado con dos controladores de neodimio de 1.7 pulgadas y radiadores pasivos, este altavoz proporciona unos graves profundos y unos agudos nítidos que llenan la habitación con un sonido equilibrado y envolvente. La tecnología de procesamiento de señal digital (DSP) ajusta automáticamente el sonido para obtener un rendimiento óptimo en diferentes géneros musicales.La potencia de salida de 16W produce un sonido potente y claro, lo que permite disfrutar de la música con gran fidelidad y detalle, incluso a volúmenes altos. Además, la función de emparejamiento inalámbrico con otros altavoces Soundcore permite crear un sistema estéreo inalámbrico para una experiencia de audio más inmersiva.Conectividad y Batería:La conectividad Bluetooth 5.0 garantiza una conexión estable y sin problemas con dispositivos compatibles, con un alcance de hasta 20 metros. La tecnología de emparejamiento rápido facilita la conexión con smartphones, tabletas y otros dispositivos Bluetooth en cuestión de segundos.Una de las características más impresionantes del Soundcore 3 es su excepcional duración de batería. Con una batería de iones de litio de alta capacidad de 4800 mAh, este altavoz ofrece hasta 24 horas de reproducción continua con una sola carga, lo que lo convierte en un compañero ideal para viajes largos o eventos al aire libre sin preocuparse por quedarse sin batería.Funcionalidades Adicionales:El altavoz Soundcore 3 cuenta con un micrófono incorporado para realizar llamadas con manos libres, lo que añade versatilidad a sus funciones. También es compatible con la aplicación Soundcore, que ofrece actualizaciones de firmware, ecualizador personalizable y la opción de personalizar la configuración de audio según las preferencias individuales del usuario.En resumen, el Soundcore 3 de Anker Soundcore es un altavoz Bluetooth excepcional que combina un diseño resistente, una calidad de sonido impresionante y una duración de batería prolongada. Su portabilidad, resistencia al agua y su potente rendimiento lo convierten en una opción ideal para aquellos que buscan un altavoz versátil y de alto rendimiento para disfrutar de la música en cualquier lugar y momento.

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good enough, I guess
reviews.author: J. Payne
reviews.content: For the price, I'm not sure if my complaints are fair, but it's my first Bluetooth speaker. It sounds awful compared to my USB portable speakers that are 10 years or more old, it sounds awful compared to my soundcore 2 ear buds.Even after manually adjusting the EQ to remove most of the bass it still sounds a little to "bassy", when listening to audiobooks. When listening to music, it's the same, it constantly sounds like there's something is blocking the speakers, everything it clear enough to hear, but then a muffled effect is layered over everything. Playing songs with bass I absolutely had to turn off the bass boost or it overwhelmed the audio. The best audio I got for music was to set it to custom and leave the low frequency flat and raise the high frequencies, but then bass acted like it was being pushed through a mid range speaker with a low pass filter.You could get decent audio, including songs with bass, by selecting treble boost or voice for music, but it still sounds like there some sort of "muffled" audio overlay on the bass. I don't know how to describe it, it's like the speaker can't produce all the base frequencies, but then they're still there coming through the speaker.Anyway if you can get it on sale it's good enough, but I'd look for coming cheaper with clear highs or spend more for a better speaker.

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars A drop in performance from the previous version of this speaker
reviews.author: Zain Kazi
reviews.content: After using the previous speaker throughout college and after graduating, I was looking forward to using the newest version of this speaker. Sadly, this speaker is a drop in quality compared to the old version.Sound QualityThe sound quality of this speaker is not really an improvement from the previous version, and regular notes sound slightly muddled, but it is not usually very noticeable. Music with words sounds good, bass quality is pretty good, but listening to something like classical music is where I notice the individual notes sounding a bit muddled. The speaker itself can get pretty loud though, which is a step up from the previous version.Battery PerformanceThe battery performance on this speaker lasts me about a week and a half of daily use. This is a significant drop from the previous speaker, which could last me a month of daily use before charging.Bluetooth ConnectivityI have less issues connecting to this speaker than I did with the previous one. With the previous version, issues could come up when I disconnected and reconnected. Haven't noticed those issues yet with this one. My biggest issue with this speaker is that there is a delay in the transmission from my phone to the speaker, so when I watch videos, the audio doesn't sync up with what is being displayed on my phone. This is incredibly frustrating as I watch a decent amount of clips, and never had this issue with the previous version.Overall, this is a nice speaker, but I don't think I would buy it again, and it's hard to justify it being worth the $55 price. The previous version was an absolute steak at $22. Paying over double the price for a slight increase in volume and not much else is absolutely not worth it in my opinion. The speaker is good as a budget speaker, but for $55, it's no longer a budget speaker, and you're better off buying something else.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars An outstanding speaker, an outstanding company.
reviews.author: Bob Moon
reviews.content: This is my second review of the Soundcore 3. My first review was based on a connectivity issue which was noted by Anker and prompted them to contact me. They resolved the issue quickly and thoughtfully. I’ve never had any company reach out like that.I’ve always been intrigued by small things that perform in surprising ways. When Bluetooth speakers first became available I was intrigued; what quality of sound could be expected from small and unobtrusive speakers? I’ve had a lot of fun finding out.Over the years I’ve occasionally updated my Bluetooth speaker based on newer models becoming better and better, particularly with bass response. Lately I’ve had a chance to listen to several current models in the $150.00 and below price range, including Sony, Bose, Tribit, JBL Flip 5, and Soundcore 3.The Soundcore 3 is the clear winner. The highs, mid range and bass are all impressive, but the bass response is really surprising. Many Bluetooth speakers sacrifice highs and mid range for a muffled, muddy bass, reducing the entire sound to an unsatisfying mess. Not so with the Soundcore 3 which provides very clear partitions between all ranges and a very, very clean bass. The first time I listened to a song with a low, bass drone, I couldn’t believe what I was hearing. It was a composition that I was familiar with. I didn’t know it had a bass drone before. As one online reviewer put it “The Soundcore 3 should not sound as good as it does.” I couldn’t agree more.So yes, the Soundcore 3 is the best Bluetooth speaker available in the sub $150.00 range, by far. It’s small enough to be almost unnoticed in a room, but fills the room with very satisfying, rich sound.

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars The Lows

Gordon Lightfoot) on stock eq at roughly 60% volume and up causes the speakers to struggle producing everything under 70hz. It begins to either bottom out or straight up distort and that was present from day one with or without the updates on 2 separate units. I have presumptions but im not sure. Either the speakers are built too shallow and they really are bottoming out OR there isn't enough pressure in the cabin so this effect doesn't happen either way its extremely unpleasant and i had to* HEAVILY modify the eq just to get it to stop even then i could never play it past 80% without feeling like it was going to self destruct. The sound here is as follows, versatile but not absolute. Certainly not for productivity. Definitely would make a fantastic gift for a child or a parent, maybe someone that just wants to play music in a more quiet environment and lower volumes. This is 100% something to take with you bike riding, walking, running, hiking, around a store to play high pitch noises that annoy everyone in the store, play at low volumes to fill in quiet space, in a car for audiobooks or voice calls. Definitely something that you don't mind losing or getting destroyed or stolen i suppose. Id give it a 6/10 for a speaker this size and at this cost but genuinely hope improvements are made.

reviews.content: The media could not be loaded. I purchased the Anker Soundcore 3 after being disappointed by the Soundcore 2’s muddy bass and non-existent mids. Aside from being close to the Soundcore 2’s general dimensions, build quality and weight, this was where the similarities end. They have upgraded to USB-C for charging and removed the 3.5mm Aux, as well as adding a strap holder for carrying the speaker around. The battery life is amazing, especially when running at lower volumes. However, the biggest game changer is the battery life. You just need to download the Anker Soundcore App from your devices App Store, then make sure you have the speaker paired. The app should recognize the speaker once you open it up and answer the various prompts. Then you will be able to control the EQ with 4 preset EQs, as well as the ability to create and save custom EQ sets for your own preferences. Without the app, you are strictly limited to the sound that comes out of the Soundcore 3 by default. The app is what truly makes this speaker feel more high than the current $50.99 price point, which is a good thing. I’m pleased to say that this is another piece of Anker gear that I’m thoroughly pleased with.

reviews.title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Piece of junk
reviews.author: Matthew
reviews.content: I have owned quite a few Soundcore products from Anker, great headphones, pretty good tws earbuds, and this has to be the sixth, I don't know, seventh bluetooth soundcore speaker I've purchased, and EVERY SINGLE ONE has developed this static-like buzzing noise. You can hear it when it's on, when it's unpaired, pairing, paired, music playing and not playing. The noise only goes away when it's off. It isn't a white noise artifact from transmission or recording or a ground issue, noise isn't causing unwanted vibrations either. I take care of my things, I don't abuse them, this one in particular I kept in a little case I bought for travel (only traveled with it once). Minimal use, never maxed out or blasted the volume. AND YET after about three weeks, to a month developed the same noise I experienced in several other Soundcore speakers. I work with audio equipment, I would say I am fairly capable in diagnosing and correcting audio issues or at least identifying the issue. It sounds like something internally is shorting or a manufacturing defect without me having taken it apart. Again, was never rough with it and a few of my friends have had the same exact issues with theirs, I should have listened to them when they said not to bother with these, but the reviews were too good to think it a persistent and constant issue. And oh boy was I wrong.By then the return window expired, going to reach out to customer service but for now I've been stuck with a 50-something dollar paper weight. The worst thing they can do is send another one. So done with their speakers.

reviews.content: First off I would like to start by saying that I am usually an earbuds person, not a speaker person.I bought this speaker to replace my old and aging Soundcore 1 speaker. The charging port was failing and I feel that it lived a happy life. Decided to buy this speaker during Amazon Prime days. Arrived fine, but after some music samples, it felt like the bass was lacking or flat with not great thumps.So a week or two later I went out and purchased a similar style competitor brand Tribit and WoW, oh my gosh was I right. The tribit hits and punches the bass really well, however, the Soundcore 3 is louder in volume but flat and not punchy in bass.Overall feelings I would have to lean towards Tribit for getting a cheap budget 14w speaker.Tribit > Soundcore 3Given this new knowledge, I am likely to buy the next model up the 24w Tribit to see if I can compensate on the volume and still get that bass punch .I totally expected more from Anker and Soundcore, but the missed on this version of speakers

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Left speaker blew out after less than 6 months
reviews.author: Corin B.
reviews.content: Update : Soundcore (Anker) reached out and offered a free replacement after some basic troubleshooting steps. I will say that even though the "Standard" warranty is 3 months (per their website), their customer support was truly exceptional. I cannot say the same about most Amazon-only brands. I am changing my review to 5 stars to reflect the customer experience received and the general satisfaction with the product.I really enjoyed this speaker while it lasted. I never used it around water and never blasted it at full volume. The sound was good and crisp for the first few months or so. It deteriorated over time to the point that I cannot listen to anything at all without hearing a loud "scratching" noise coming from the left speaker. I wouldn't be as upset if Anker (the parent company of Soundcore) offered a decent warranty period for their products. In the US this (and all of their other products) come with a 3 MONTH warranty. Needless to say, I will NOT be buying any Anker products - this includes TaoTronics, Anker, Soundcore, Eufy, Bolder, ZULU, Roav and whatever new brand they come up with in the future.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2022
